column4: so ATM I am signed on to a connection in a coffee shop.  Not the shops mind you. Just a randon open coeenction.  when I tried to get to the coffee shops (which is un encrypted BTW) my little net work manager icon just went and went and never connected>  is there a was to connect via the command line so that I could see the errors?
check iwconfig
you can use it to connect and scan for APs
sure, the livecd has a usb installer on it
so I need two usb drives or can I just mnt the live cd in a vbox and install to the USB drive from there?
if you want you can use tools etc to put the liveCD on the usb and boot from that
I only have one USB drive handy, can I load the live image on to it, boot from it then wipe the usb  and install on to the usb from the boot in the memeory?
sure, i use my girlfriends lappy + this personally: http://www.pendrivelinux.com/create-a-ubuntu-9-10-live-usb-in-windows/  works with lucid too

I am already using ubuntu, but due to a ATI video card I have avoided upgrading beyond 8.10, but I have heard that people have had luck getting 3d effects by using some other drivers I just want to try
i dont use arti, so i am no help. 8.10 is getting dropped some point next month so look out
s/arti/ati
I know, its either down grade to LTS, changes distors, or upgrade and lose 3d support
or a new video card, a cheapo nvidia thing will do much better
it's a lappy

ah, i see. Then you hit the nail on the head. personally i'd just sack off some eyecandy for a decent distro of linux. You will find the other distros are the same as they are essentially the same OS, Linux
its just good to thank people when they help
which thinkpad is it?
does hitting Fn+F8 help?
no
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
its actually lisa as this is a mint box but the under the hood architecture is so similar that I came here
